newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey 1996 budget deficit 1,215 trillion lira.
newsitem.headline: Turkey 1996 budget deficit 1,215 trillion lira.

text.p: Turkey's budget deficit in 1996 totalled 1,215 trillion Turkish lira ($10.6 billion), up from 316.6 trillion a year ago, Finance Minister Abdullatif Sener said.
Government revenues during the year amounted to 2,736 trillion lira and spending totalled 3,951 trillion, he told a news conference.
"The budget deficit came out 85 trillion lira less than expected because of an increase in the effectiveness of fiscal management and tax administration in the second half," Sener said.
He said the deficit was equal to 8.2 percent of GNP, compared with a forecast of 8.8 percent.
Parliament last month approved the government's planned balanced budget for 1997. Financial analysts are sceptical about its aims of wiping out the deficit.
